extendedIngredients.name: butter lettuce
extendedIngredients.original: 1 small head butter lettuce, torn into pieces

extendedIngredients.name: shrimp
extendedIngredients.original: 1 1/2 pounds cooked medium shrimp, cut in half crosswise
extendedIngredients.originalName: cooked medium shrimp, cut in half crosswise

title: Creamy Shrimp Rolls
summary: Creamy Shrimp Rolls is a dairy free and pescatarian hor d'oeuvre. This recipe makes 4 servings with 585 calories, 42g of protein, and 27g of fat each. For $4.65 per serving, this recipe covers 32% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. Only a few people made this recipe, and 1 would say it hit the spot. Head to the store and pick up mayonnaise, kosher salt and pepper, hot dog buns, and a few other things to make it today. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 72%. This score is solid. Similar recipes are Creamy Ham Rolls, Shrimp Egg Rolls, and Shrimp Rolls.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc are my top picks for Shrimp. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. The Zind-Humbrecht Calcaire Pinot Gris with a 4.7 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 46 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Zind-Humbrecht Calcaire Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: Bright yellow/gold color, quite luminous. Superb smoky toasty nose, typical for this grape on limestone in Alsace (no new oak in our wines, just very long total lees contact). Some light reductive aromas that actually fit the style of dry Pinot-Gris. The palate is rich and creamy, with a velvety texture yet fully dry. It is an easy wine to drink now as there is no unnecessary weight. The finish is nice and round but fully dry. The complex limestone blend brings great acid balance and a certain weight. It should develop very nicely over the next few years.

instructions: In a medium bowl, whisk the mayonnaise, lemon juice, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Fold in the shrimp, celery, and chives, if desired. Line the buns with the lettuce and fill with the shrimp mixture. Serve with the potato chips.

steps.step: In a medium bowl, whisk the mayonnaise, lemon juice, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Fold in the shrimp, celery, and chives, if desired. Line the buns with the lettuce and fill with the shrimp mixture.
